history.content:
Nope, a P is a C- and higher. 

https://registrar.berkeley.edu/faculty-staff/grading/grading-policies-reports

But if you take a class for a letter grade and get a D-/D/D+, then it counts for the graduation requirement. 

So there is an edge case where if you are in track for some sort of D and you need the class to graduate you should take it for letter grade. 

As for if they will change policies to count D as a P? I doubt it, but I also doubt you will get an official answer here, you should ask your L&S or equivalent EECS advisor

will a D be considered as a P this semester?
history.subject: passing grade
